subject: Re: [junit] Adding setUp() and tearDown() to TestSuite
msgSnippet: I think one very common case is wanting to have the TestSetup arrangement, yet still be able to run the tests within the suite either singly or as a group.
messageBody:
I think one very common case is wanting to have the TestSetup
arrangement, yet still be able to run the tests within the suite either
singly or as a group. There's nothing in the framework that really
supports this. If you extract a single test from TestSetup to run you
don't get the wrapper.

T.

On Monday, September 23, 2002, at 06:42 AM, Robert Watkins wrote:

> On Mon, 2002-09-23 at 20:00, "Schaible, JÃ¶rg" wrote:
>> I would like to get the group's opinion about adding setUp() and
>> tearDown() methods to the TestSuite class
>
> Why would you want it? It already there, just have a look at the
> extensions: class TestSetup. Use it, if you need it!
>
> Or you could read his message. :) David made it clear that TestSetup
> didn't cut it for him.
>
> Robert.
>
> --
> "Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
